Citeline, is part of the Norstella group of Pharma information solutions, is one of the world's leading providers of data and intelligence on clinical trials, drug treatments, medical devices and what's new in the regulatory and commercial landscape. Relying on us to deliver vital advantage when making critical R&D and commercial decisions, our customers come from over 3000 of the world’s leading pharmaceutical, contract research organizations (CROs), medical technology, biotechnology and healthcare service providers, including the top 10 global pharma and CROs.From drug and device discovery and development to regulatory approval, and from product launch to lifecycle management, we provide the intelligence and insight to help our customers seize opportunities, mitigate risk and make business-critical decisions, faster. As the pharma and healthcare sector faces unparalleled upheaval, customers rely on our independent advice, enabling them to cut through the clutter and make sense of changing drug development, regulatory and competitive landscapes.SummaryDue to expanding our Data & Insight team, we are looking for an energetic Data & Insight ManagerData & Insight Service Manager will lead the data platform development activities and coordinate the team effortsD&I Service Manager maintains a strong working knowledge of data & analytics industry standards and practices as well as the company's products and services.D & I Service Manager will handle interactions with the business stakeholders and business partners, manage demand and expectations, proactively work towards mitigating issues around data analytics.D&I Service Manager should display a strong collaborative attitude towards data engineering team and business partners, building strong, positive relationships with business partners and work towards delivering excellent service.The D&I manager should have an experience in developing analytics solutions for Sales, Marketing and FinanceHandling stakeholders issues or concerns quickly and professionally to maintain good relationships.Communicate with stakeholders verbally and in writing to sufficiently inform them of the statuses of tasks and issues.Monitoring issues and complaints to create methods to lessen recurring issuesMaintaining strong relationships with all Norstella entities as well as external vendors.Helping to train new employees in Data & Insight procedures.ResponsibilitiesCo-leading the Enterprise Data & Insight Platform development team with a close co-operation with the Enterprise Data Architect, data engineering team, partnering with various business units in Norstella company.Manage priorities, expectations from the business and collaborate on roadmap creation for the Enterprise Data & Insight Platform.Delegating and directing data engineering tasks, monitoring the progress of current projects, and managing the teams workload to ensure the team's objectives and goals are met, securing support for various stakeholders.Working towards one data vision – one source of truth to equip business stakeholders with reliable information for making operational and management decisions.Drive workload analysis agenda and provide insights for optimization of budget, resource allocation, workload for teams impacting the deliverables to business.Co-creation of standards, procedures and policies for the enterprise related to data access, reporting tools access, issue reporting & resolution.And other duties as assigned.Requirements A bachelor's degree in data science, computing, mathematics or related field.5+ years of business intelligence consulting experience.Strong data & analytics experience for the front end and back-end solutions:Font end - BI tools experience in Power BI, Tableau or DomoBackend - Data warehousing tools experience such as Snowflake and AWS data stack (Redshift, Glue, Lambda, S3, Apache Airflow).Strong creative thinking and problem-solving skills.The ability to work under pressure and handle stress.Ability to create standards, procedures, instructions.Drive to develop and improve the service.Ability to collect and analyze business requirements.Excellent leadership, communication, and customer service skills.Bring your truth You. Be open to new things and new ideas. Be opened to learn. Be opened to raise and learn from mistakes. Be always honest.BenefitsThe expected base salary for this position ranges from $110,000 to $160,000. It is not typical for offers to be made at or near the top of the range. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, licensure or certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to base salary and a competitive benefits package, successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus.Norstella is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, gender reassignment, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, disability or age. Our ethos is to respect and value people’s differences, to help everyone achieve more at work as well as in their personal lives so that they feel proud of the part they play in our success. We believe that all decisions about people at work should be based on the individual’s abilities, skills, performance and behavior and our business requirements. Norstella operates a zero tolerance policy to any form of discrimination, abuse or harassmentSometimes the best opportunities are hidden by self-doubt. We disqualify ourselves before we have the opportunity to be considered. Regardless of where you came from, how you identify, or the path that led you here- you are welcome. If you read this job description and feel passion and excitement, we’re just as excited about you.
